FuncDef:
The binding-sid command configures a binding SID for an SR-MPLS TE Policy.
The undo binding-sid command deletes the binding SID configured for an SR-MPLS TE Policy.
By default, no binding SID is configured for an SR-MPLS TE Policy.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a binding SID.
The value is an integer ranging from 16 to 1048575. The range dynamically changes and consists of a static label range and an SRLB range (if configured). The actual range varies according to the device.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Only one binding SID can be configured for each SR-MPLS TE Policy. It can be used for SR-MPLS TE path computation as other types of SIDs.
An SR-MPLS TE Policy that is manually configured does not carry any binding SID by default. You can configure a binding SID for such an SR-MPLS TE Policy as needed.An SR-MPLS TE Policy dynamically delivered by a controller carries a binding SID by default. If a dynamically delivered SR-MPLS TE Policy does not carry any binding SID, you can manually configure an SR-MPLS TE Policy with the same color and endpoint attributes as the dynamically delivered SR-MPLS TE Policy, and then run the binding-sid command to configure a binding SID for the manually configured SR-MPLS TE Policy. In this way, both SR-MPLS TE Policies can share the same binding SID.
